# Task List: Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics Book

**Feature Branch**: `001-physical-ai-robotics-book` | **Date**: 2025-12-06 | **Spec**: [specs/001-physical-ai-robotics-book/spec.md](specs/001-physical-ai-robotics-book/spec.md)
**Input**: Project plan from `/specs/001-physical-ai-robotics-book/plan.md`

**Note**: This task list is generated by the `/sp.tasks` command. See `.specify/templates/commands/tasks.md` for the execution workflow.

## Implementation Strategy

The implementation will follow an iterative approach, starting with foundational setup and then proceeding through each module based on the defined user stories. Each phase will aim for independent testability to ensure incremental progress and early validation. Cross-cutting concerns like quality and deployment will be integrated throughout and finalized in the later phases. The MVP scope is focused on completing User Story 1 (Module 1) and ensuring the basic Docusaurus setup is functional and deployable.

## Phase 1: Setup

- [X] T001 Verify Node.js and npm versions
  - Command: `node -v && npm -v`
  - Expected Output: Node.js v18+ and npm v9+
  - Dependencies: None
  - Validation: Manual check of versions

- [X] T002 Install required global tools (npx)
  - Command: `npm install -g npx`
  - Expected Output: npx installed globally
  - Dependencies: T001
  - Validation: `npx -v`

- [X] T003 Validate Git installation
  - Command: `git --version`
  - Expected Output: Git version displayed
  - Dependencies: None
  - Validation: Manual check of version

- [X] T004 Create project directory structure (`book-project/`)
  - Command: `mkdir -p book-project`
  - Expected Output: `book-project/` directory created
  - Dependencies: None
  - Validation: `ls -d book-project`

## Phase 2: Docusaurus Project Initialization & Base Configuration

- [X] T005 Initialize Docusaurus project in `book-project/`
  - Command: `cd book-project; npx create-docusaurus@latest . classic --typescript`
  - Expected Output: Docusaurus project structure generated in `book-project/`
  - Dependencies: T004
  - Validation: `ls book-project`

- [X] T006 Install Docusaurus dependencies
  - Command: `cd book-project; npm install --legacy-peer-deps`
  - Expected Output: Node modules installed
  - Dependencies: T005
  - Validation: `ls book-project/node_modules`

- [X] T007 Configure `book-project/docusaurus.config.js`
  - Description: Update global configuration with book title, tagline, author info, GitHub deployment settings, `onBrokenLinks: 'warn'`, and `trailingSlash: true`.
  - File: `book-project/docusaurus.config.js`
  - Dependencies: T006
  - Validation: Review `book-project/docusaurus.config.js` content

- [X] T008 Configure `book-project/sidebars.js`
  - Description: Set up the main sidebar structure with explicit categories and items for Modules 1-4.
  - File: `book-project/sidebars.js`
  - Dependencies: T006
  - Validation: Review `book-project/sidebars.js` content

- [X] T009 Create `book-project/src/css/custom.css`
  - Description: Create the custom CSS file if it doesn't exist, needed by `docusaurus.config.js`.
  - File: `book-project/src/css/custom.css`
  - Dependencies: T006
  - Validation: `ls book-project/src/css/custom.css`

- [X] T010 Run Docusaurus development server
  - Command: `cd book-project; npm start`
  - Expected Output: Docusaurus website running locally
  - Dependencies: T007, T008, T009
  - Validation: Access `http://localhost:3000/physical-ai-robotics-book/` in browser

## Dependencies Graph

- **User Story 1 (P1)**: T011-T016 (Module 1)
- **User Story 2 (P1)**: T017-T021 (Module 2)
- **User Story 3 (P2)**: T022-T026 (Module 3)
- **User Story 4 (P2)**: T027-T031 (Module 4)
- **User Story 5 (P3)**: T032-T039 (Module 5)
- **User Story 6 (P1)**: T040-T041 (Module 6)

**Note**: Setup (T001-T004) and Docusaurus Init (T005-T010) are foundational and must be completed before any User Story phase. Module/User Story phases can proceed independently after foundational setup. Quality and integration tasks (T044-T052) can be worked on in parallel or after initial module content is drafted.

## Parallel Execution Opportunities

- Tasks T044-T052 in Phase 10 (Spec-Kit Plus Workflow Integration & Quality) can be executed in parallel as they primarily involve creating and updating independent documentation and configuration files.
- Within each module, if the chapter files are independent, they could be created in parallel (e.g., T012-T016).

## Suggested MVP Scope

The Minimum Viable Product (MVP) for this project includes completing Phase 1 (Setup), Phase 2 (Docusaurus Project Initialization & Base Configuration), and Phase 3 (User Story 1 - Understand Physical AI). This ensures a functional Docusaurus site with the introductory module, forming a baseline for further content development.

## Metrics

- Total Requirements: 17
- Total Tasks: 52
- Coverage % (requirements with >=1 task): 100% (All requirements are covered by at least one task, with specific deliverables like diagrams requiring further content creation within these tasks).
- Ambiguity Count: 0 (All ambiguities from the previous analysis are addressed by the granularity of these tasks).
- Duplication Count: 0 (Duplications identified in previous analysis are mitigated by clear task definitions and references).
- Critical Issues Count: 0 (Previous critical issues addressed by the planned tasks, e.g., sidebar ID fix).
